title: How to Draw a Christmas Landscape

steps.title: Start by drawing the land.
steps.content: Start by drawing the land. Since this is a winter landscape, the ground will be covered with snow.

steps.title: Draw another curved line on the background of the first.
steps.content: Draw another curved line on the background of the first.

steps.title: Draw two or more pine trees.
steps.content: Draw two or more pine trees. If you notice, they look like triangles with jagged edges.

steps.title: Add a Christmas star in the sky.
steps.content: Add a Christmas star in the sky. Add a star on each of the trees. Don't forget to put a little bit of snow on the tree.

steps.title: Paint your drawing.
steps.content: Paint your drawing. Use soft colors like sky blue, and a very pale purple and white for the sky and snow. And, of course, paint the trees green. Use gradients and texture as you wish.

steps.title: Draw curvy lines.
steps.content: Draw curvy lines. This will eventually become snow and hills.

steps.title: Start sketching the sky.
steps.content: Start sketching the sky. Draw clouds, and, if desired, add a sun or moon. Make sure that you don't add anything onto the bottom section.

steps.title: Draw a Christmas tree
steps.content: Draw a Christmas tree . Add lights and ornaments.

steps.title: Add in a snowman
steps.content: Add in a snowman or two.

steps.title: Add details.
steps.content: Add details. Consider adding falling snow, or animals such as reindeer.

steps.title: Outline your drawing with permanent media (like ink,marker,sketch pen,etc.
steps.content: Outline your drawing with permanent media (like ink,marker,sketch pen,etc. ). Make sure to erase all your guidelines.
